meanings.sent1: The old door scrooped loudly when it opened.
meanings.sent2: I heard the branches scrooping against the window in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The rusty swing scrooped as the children played on it.
meanings.sent4: The car brakes scrooped as it came to a sudden stop.
meanings.sent5: The metal gate scrooped as it swung back and forth in the breeze.

meanings.definition: To move with a scraping noise
meanings.sent1: She scrooped the chair across the floor to reach the book.
meanings.sent2: The cat scrooped along the hallway, trying to be stealthy.
meanings.sent3: The heavy box scrooped as he dragged it across the room.
meanings.sent4: The shovel scrooped against the pavement as he cleared the snow.
meanings.sent5: The wheels of the cart scrooped as it rolled down the hill.

meanings.sent1: The scrooping of the rusty gate echoed through the garden.
meanings.sent2: The scrooping of the chalk on the blackboard made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent3: The scrooping of the old violin made the audience chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The scrooping of the brakes startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent5: The scrooping of the hinges signaled the arrival of the guests.
